item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals December 2025 Community Day Details
item.description:
On November 10, Pokemon GO revealed its December 2025 Community Day lineup a month in advance, as creatures from previous Community Day events will return for another weekend. The upcoming Pokemon GO Community Day event will be held during the first full weekend of December, and trainers will have a chance to catch up to 16 unique Pokemon with the same Shiny odds as previous events.

Since its introduction in 2018, Pokemon GO Community Days have been utilized as a way for trainers to meet up and catch different Pokemon throughout the world. While a Community Day is active, specific Pokemon receive an increased chance to be Shiny, which can make them more enticing for some trainers to catch. The October 2025 Pokemon GO Community Day put the spotlight on Solosis, the Psychic-type Cell Pokemon that first appeared in Pokemon Black and White . Any Pokemon caught during a Community Day event will receive a unique move once fully evolved, with Solosis gaining Charm after evolving to Reuniclus.

Although Pokemon GO is starting to run out of new creatures to add to the game, trainers who missed out on past Pokemon GO Community Day events will have another chance to catch some rare critters. Pokemon GO 's final Community Day event of 2025 will be held on Saturday, December 6, and Sunday, December 7, from 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM local time. All previous creatures that were spotlighted on Pokemon GO Community Days in 2025 will return for an encore in the December event, including Totodile and the Paldean Starter trio of Sprigatito, Fuecoco, and Quaxly. Different flower variations of Flabebe will also be spotlighted, though the Yellow, Red, and Blue variants will be region-specific. During the last 10 minutes of each Community Day hour, Pokemon like Ralts and Eevee will appear in the wild.

Like previous Pokemon GO Community Days, trainers will also obtain twice as much Candy, Stardust, and XP when catching a Pokemon during the event. Ahead of the final Community Day of 2025, Pokemon GO increased its storage capacity limit by 650 to a total of 11,150. Ergo, trainers looking to capture a lot of Pokemon during the December 2025 Community Day will not need to worry about running out of room for them.

Additionally, trainers looking to prepare for the December Community Day can take advantage of the November 2025 Pokemon GO Pass rewards and stock up on some nifty items. It remains to be seen how many trainers will take part in the final Pokemon GO Community Day of the year.

Pokemon GO December 2025 Community Day Details

Saturday, December 6, and Sunday, December 7, 2025, from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time.

Featured Pokemon

The following Pokemon will be featured on Saturday, December 6, 2025, from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time.

  • Karrablast*
  • Shelmet*
  • Vanillite*
  • Sprigatito*
  • Fuecoco*
  • Pawmi*

The following Pokemon will be featured on Sunday, December 7, 2025, from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time.

  • Solosis*
  • Red Flower Flabebe in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa*
  • Blue Flower Flabebe in the Asia-Pacific region*
  • Yellow Flower Flabebe in the Americas*
  • Pikipek*
  • Jangmo-o*
  • Rookidee*
  • Quaxly*

During the event hours on Sunday you might encounter White Flower Flabebe and Orange Flower Flabebe, no matter what region you’re in—if you’re lucky!

For the last ten minutes of each hour between 2:00 p.m. and 5:00 p.m. local time on both days, Trainers can catch an opportunity to encounter these Pokemon!

  • Machop*
  • Eevee*
  • Totodile*
  • Ralts*

*If you’re lucky, you may encounter a Shiny one!

Featured Attack Details

The following featured attacks will be available when evolving these Pokémon from Saturday, December 6 at 9:00 a.m local time to Sunday, December 7, 2025, 9:00 p.m. local time.

Machamp

Evolve Machoke (Machop’s Evolution) to get a Machamp that knows the Charged Attack Payback.

Eevee

Eevee caught or hatched during the event will know the Charged Attack Last Resort.

Evolve Eevee into any of its Evolutions and that Pokémon will know a featured attack:

  • Vaporeon will know the Charged Attack Scald.
  • Jolteon will know the Charged Attack Zap Cannon.
  • Flareon will know the Charged Attack Superpower.
  • Espeon will know the Charged Attack Shadow Ball.
  • Umbreon will know the Charged Attack Psychic.
  • Leafeon will know the Fast Attack Bullet Seed.
  • Glaceon will know the Charged Attack Water Pulse.
  • Sylveon will know the Charged Attack Psyshock.

Feraligatr

Evolve Croconaw (Totodile’s Evolution) to get a Feraligatr that knows the Charged Attack Hydro Cannon.

Gardevoir and Gallade

Evolve Kirlia (Ralts’s Evolution) to get a Gardevoir or Gallade that knows the Charged Attack Synchronoise.

Reuniclus

Evolve Duosion (Solosis’s Evolution) to get a Reuniclus that knows the Fast Attack Charm.

Vanilluxe

Evolve Vanillish (Vanillite’s Evolution) to get a Vanilluxe that knows the Charged Attack Avalanche.

Escavalier

Evolve Karrablast to get an Escavalier that knows the Charged Attack Razor Shell.

Accelgor

Evolve Shelmet to get an Accelgor that knows the Charged Attack Energy Ball.

Florges

Evolve Floette (Flabébé’s Evolution) to get a Florges that knows the Charged Attack Chilling Water.

Toucannon

Evolve Trumbeak (Pikipek’s Evolution) to get a Toucannon that knows the Charged Attack Beak Blast.

Kommo-o

Evolve Hakamo-o (Jangmo-o’s Evolution) to get a Kommo-o that knows the Charged Attack Clanging Scales.

Corviknight

Evolve Corvisquire (Rookidee’s Evolution) to get a Corviknight that knows the Charged Attack Air Cutter.

Meowscarada

Evolve Floragato (Sprigatito’s Evolution) to get a Meowscarada that knows the Charged Attack Frenzy Plant.

Skeledirge

Evolve Crocalor (Fuecoco’s Evolution) to get a Skeledirge that knows the Charged Attack Blast Burn.

Quaquaval

Evolve Quaxwell (Quaxly’s Evolution) to get a Quaquaval that knows the Charged Attack Hydro Cannon.

Pawmot

Evolve Pawmo (Pawmi’s Evolution) to get a Pawmot that knows the Charged Attack Brick Break.

Event Bonuses

  • Limited-time Evolution requirement: Evolve Eevee into Espeon after exploring 1 km with Eevee as your buddy.*
  • Limited-time Evolution requirement: Evolve Eevee into Umbreon after exploring 1 km with Eevee as your buddy.*
  • Limited-time Evolution requirement: Evolve Eevee into Sylveon after earning seven hearts with Eevee as your buddy.*
  • Limited-time Evolution requirement: Evolve Floette into Florges after earning seven hearts with Floette as your buddy.*
  • Limited-time Evolution requirement: Evolve Pawmo into Pawmot after exploring 1 km with Pawmo as your buddy.*
  • 2× XP for catching Pokemon.
  • 2× Stardust for catching Pokemon.
  • 1/2 Hatch Distance when Eggs are placed into Incubators during the event period.
  • 2× Candy for catching Pokemon.
  • 2× chance for Trainers level 31 and up to receive Candy XL from catching Pokemon.
  • Incense (excluding Daily Adventure Incense) activated during the event will last for three hours.
  • Lure Modules activated during the event will last for one hour.**
  • One additional Special Trade can be made, for a maximum of three per day.**
  • Trades made during the event will require 50% less Stardust.**

*These Evolution requirements will return to the usual requirements on December 7, 2025, at 9:00 p.m. local time. Prior progress made on the usual requirements will reset when the event begins.

**While most bonuses are only active on December 6 and 7 from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time, these bonuses will be active from Saturday, December 6, at 9:00 a.m. to Sunday, December 7, at 9:00 p.m. local time.

December Community Day 2025 Special Research

For US$4.99 (or the equivalent pricing tier in your local currency), you’ll be able to access the December Community Day–exclusive Special Research for the event.

Complete the Special Research tasks to receive the following:

  • Encounters with Pokémon featured in previous Community Days and Community Day Classics in 2025
  • One Elite Charged TM
  • One Elite Fast TM
  • One Rocket Radar
  • Stay tuned for when tickets for the Special Research go live.
  • Don’t forget: you’re now able to purchase and gift tickets to any of your friends that you’ve achieved a Friendship level of Great Friends or higher with.
  • To gift a ticket, tap the Special Research ticket in the in-game shop, then tap the Gift button instead of the Buy button.

Tickets are nonrefundable (subject to applicable law and the exceptions set forth in the Terms of Service). Please note that this Special Research will not include an in-game medal.

*Certain restrictions apply. Gifting cannot be completed if the recipient has purchased a Special Research ticket or has been gifted one already.

Field Research

Field Research leading to encounters with Pokemon featured in previous Community Days in 2025 will be available.

Collection Challenges

Event-themed Collection Challenges are coming!

Complete catch-focused Collection Challenges to receive Stardust and XP.

Pokémon GO Web Store – Ultra Community Day Box

An Ultra Community Day Box featuring one Premium Battle Pass and one Special Research ticket will be available on the Pokemon GO Web Store during the event for US$4.99 (or the equivalent pricing tier in your local currency).

Miscellaneous

There will not be a Seasonal Special Background for December Community Day 2025.

106
8.4 /10

Pokémon GO

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Pokémon GO is an immersive open-world multiplayer RPG that enables you to live your own RPG adventure in augmented reality. Find and evolve all Pokémon and battle with other players in AR online in this multiplayer adventure RPG.

COMPLETE YOUR POKÉDEX AND INCREASE YOUR TRAINER LEVEL!
Catch your favourite Pokémon as you explore the open world in augmented reality, trade them with other Trainers, or get the chance to catch a Pokémon after winning a Raid. You can also collect Pokémon by hatching eggs through walking! Evolve your Pokémon in your Pokédex, gain levels to catch more powerful Pokémon and earn adventure rewards during a Raid in multiplayer or online PvP battle.

EXPERIENCE THE ADVENTURE IN MULTIPLAYER AND PvP!
Start your own adventure and challenge other Trainers online in PvP during epic Gym battles or in the GO Battle League. You can also enjoy multiplayer by facing off with other players in PvP battles to win rewards, or team up with other Trainers for a chance to catch Pokémon after a Raid Battle.

CREATE YOUR OWN ADVENTURE!
Customise your avatar, join one of the three teams and pick your Buddy Pokémon from your Pokédex to journey by your side in this AR adventure RPG.

SWITCH BETWEEN THE REAL WORLD AND THE VIRTUAL WORLD WITH THE AR+ MODE!
Bring the RPG to the real world and search for Pokémon in locations around you. With the AR+ mode, Pokémon appear right in front of you — Catch it with your PokéBall and add it to your Pokédex.

Catch your favourite Pokémon in AR as you explore the world and battle online with other Trainers in PvP and Raid battles.

Cross-Platform Play
Yes
Cross Save
Yes

item.title: Ready Or Not: Best Weapons, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Ready or Not features 4 weapon categories - Assault Rifles, Shotguns, SMGs, and Pistols. Players must choose their loadout carefully to survive missions.
  • The VKS and Beanbag Shotgun are non-lethal weapons that can help players detain enemies instead of killing them.
  • The MPX is a fast-reloading SMG that allows players to unload bullets quickly without worrying about running out of ammo.

Ready or Not features 4 categories of weapons, Assault Rifles, Shotguns, SMGs, and Pistols. These categories all have their own advantages, but players can only bring one primary weapon and one secondary weapon into every Ready or Not mission, so players are going to have to spend some time in the arsenal to figure out what the correct loadout would be to survive every encounter and gain that elusive S Rank.

The best weapons in Ready or Not will certainly help players in hostile situations, but a level of skill is still required, as players will need to be like John Wick if they are supposed to survive one of the hardest but best tactical shooters of 2025. Ready or Not ’s best weapons feature both lethal and non-lethal choices for all.

Updated on November 15, 2025, by Jake Fillery: Ready or Not has a hefty arsenal of weapons, and there's no dedicated meta to its design. This means that players can practically run any gun that they deem worthy of using, as it's all about personal preference. However, if players want a weapon that looks cool, feels reliable, and shoots hostiles dead, then we've got a varied selection of shotguns, rifles, pistols, and submachine guns for you to pick from. Check out some of our favorite weapons so you can decide on the best gun to use in Ready or Not!

25 UMP-9

An Extremely Fast-Firing SMG to Tear Through Tissue and Armor

If you're in a mission where enemies are heavily armored, then maybe it's time to say goodbye to non-lethal and bring out the big guns. Or, in this case, a small gun with JHP bullets. JHP bullets are used to be extremely effective against heavy armor, and these bullets complement the UMP-9 very well. The UMP-9 is extremely fast-firing when in full auto, and even with such a laser beam-like fire mode, the recoil is moderate and controllable. With a high magazine count, players are going to unload death into the area of hostiles without breaking a sweat.

It's a smaller SMG than most, but that just means it's more mobile and portable, allowing you to swiftly clear rooms and engage with hostiles without worrying about ammunition, but distance might be a tad difficult to work with. It's best to use this gun at close range, and no armor is enough to stop the penetrating power of this gun.

24 GA51

A Battle Rifle with Short Range for Decent Recoil and Intense Fire

The GA51 is a powerhouse of a gun, in which players will be blessed with something that is going to tear through opponents and their armor, so long as you're not looking to play on non-lethal. The GA51 hits hard, and the smaller frame of the gun, along with its shortened barrel, makes it ideal for close-range combat in missions where players are expected to be in some pretty tight spots.

With plenty of ammo in each magazine, players will never have to fear running empty on bullets by the time they're finished putting holes in hostiles. Just don't use this weapon for non-lethal runs, and you'll be alright, as the recoil is very manageable, and the mixture of close-range and medium-range gunplay makes this a worthy weapon.

23 LVAR

A Carbine Rifle With a Built-in Suppressor

The LVAR is one of the best guns in the game for a few reasons. Firstly, it's one of the most well-designed weapons, and it's always nice to run into battle with a gun that looks as good as it feels to fire. On the topic of firing, it's going to be a quiet delight due to its built-in suppressor.

With most guns looking better than they feel, the LVAR certainly stands out, and the fact that a suppressor is added to it automatically makes it one of the better weapons, and its attachments are rather freeing for more personalized use.

22 MCX

A Popular and Modern Assault Rifle for Performance and Customization

There's a good reason why the MCX is a popular choice among law enforcement who jump into the game ready for action. It's a smaller carbine rifle, one that provides a brilliant performance with a great option for customization.

The MCX has a myriad of potential with its recoil control and magazine capacity, and it functions as one of the best assault rifles that will certainly aid players across their combat experiences. With its stopping power, most engagements will end with one shot.

21 SLR47

An AK-Based Assault Rifle With Reliable Control

The AK47 is a classically designed weapon that features in practically every modern shooter, and the SLR47 brings forth that trend with some tactical realism. The appearance itself is great for those who simply adore this weapon, even if its shorter and stubbier design could warrant that of an AKS-74U.

Performance-wise, it's a competent choice, a weapon that can mostly 2-tap enemies, which helps drop them fast and quick, even those armored to the teeth. Its appearance is fun, and its recoil doesn't provide greatness in heavy engagements, so try to keep shooting accurately to see the true benefits of this gun.

20 Tactical Shield

Protect Against Direct Fire With This Tactical

The Tactical Shield is something that all players can equip as their tactical addition, but it's also something that can only be used with sidearms. As such, it's not wise to run in with just a Tactical Shield, as players might have an incredible defense, but they will also have nothing to return fire with, thus leaving them in a pretty vulnerable spot. Armed with a sidearm, players can navigate dangerous areas and take direct fire to the face, thanks to the safety and competent durability of the Tactical Shield. Be warned; it can shatter, and it's not wise to stay out in the open with this slow-moving support weapon.

19 M14S-16

A Battle Rifle For Sharpshooters

Not many players prefer to play with a rifle in single-fire mode, and that's why the M14S-16 also offers an auto mode as well. However, that is not the recommended fire mode as the recoil is really difficult to control, especially knowing that no vertical grip can be installed on the weapon.

That being said, M14S-16 does feel powerful when used as a single-fire marksman rifle. That is where this weapon excels. Giving the sharpshooters a joyful feel of what a decades-old weapon is capable of doing in modern chaotic engagements.

18 F90

A Compact Bullpup Rifle Ideal For Close Quarters And Long Ranges

The F90 is a great Assault Rifle choice for those who want something that retains its roots with an SMG twist. The F90 is a compact weapon, and it truly shines when it comes to maneuverability and adapting to tight corners and small rooms. This makes the F90 a decent choice for combat, as it can deal with enemies quickly thanks to its responsive fire rate and recoil, and the longer barrel allows it to be used at further distances than a shotgun or SMG just wouldn't be able to hit.

17 MP5SD6

A Reliable SMG With A Built-In Silencer

Inheriting the same base as MP5, the MP5SD6 is a special build that comes with a silencer equipped by default, which is the reason why it is pretty quiet, even when compared to other weapons with a suppressor on their muzzle. So, it is indeed the best option for anyone thinking of a solo run and does need to fight quietly.

Aside from being quite silent, the weapon also comes with a very slight and quite controllable vertical recoil, which is just what every MP5 is known for. So, this weapon is actually suitable for using with magnified scopes, though that might not be every player's preference.

16 MP5A3

A Modern Marvel SMG With Incredible Recoil

Some players might want something a little more agile to bring into the field. For those players, it's best to look at the MP5A3 SMG, which comes as a more modern version of the MP5, with major improvements to its design and handling. The MP5A3 is lightweight, allowing players to move faster, and its lack of recoil makes it so easy to use, as players will be aiming at targets and unleashing bullets of fury with little kick to stop their accuracy. The MP5A3 can fire fast and accurately with little resistance, making it a competent pick.

item.title: Escape From Tarkov's 1.0 Release Might Shoot Itself in the Foot
item.description:
After years of system overhauls, wipes, and balance experiments, Escape from Tarkov is finally set for its 1.0 release on November 15. It's a moment that should feel celebratory for longtime fans like myself, but in all honesty, the reality may not measure up to the sort of finality and polish the long-awaited "going gold" moment implies. I'm worried about whether this release will actually fix what's been holding Escape From Tarkov back: persistent cheating issues and non-stop performance problems.

Update uncertainty isn't a new thing for Battlestate Games' ambitious extraction shooter, as Tarkov built its reputation through authentic developer communication and bold, experimental design. That said, those same qualities have also fueled considerable player frustration. Escape from Tarkov 's worst issues remain essentially untouched, and unless version 1.0 brings tangible improvements to stability and security, I think there's a real risk that the official launch of Tarkov 1.0 will be defined by the problems it hasn't resolved.

Tarkov's Two Most Persistent Problems

Cheating and optimization have long been the twin problems keeping Tarkov from fully realizing its vision. The game's cheating crisis is well-documented, even by the standards of competitive shooters. Additionally, as anyone who doesn't run a space-program adjacent rig will know, the technical instability has become equally defining.

In the eight years and hundreds of updates since Escape from Tarkov 's closed beta release, inconsistent frame rates, micro-stutters, and severe desync still make Tarkov 's firefights feel random even when everyone's playing fairly. Combined with widespread wall hacks, loot vacuuming, and near-omniscient tracking, the resulting experience is what we have now: one that feels unstable by every metric. For too long, these two issues have made Escape from Tarkov 's already demanding gameplay even more punishing in all the wrong ways.

The Long Shadow of Tarkov's Cheating Problem

Cheating is arguably Escape from Tarkov 's most critical issue due to its intersection with the game's core design. Death in Tarkov means losing everything, and when that death comes from a cheater, the sting is more than a little profound. The methods vary, but the most common exploits are all bad news; be it players report being tracked through walls, or entering supposedly fresh raids only to find that every valuable item has already been vacuumed from the map.

The Escape from Tarkov subreddit's "Cheater Megathread" from August 2022, collected over 2,000 comments documenting encounters with cheaters.

What makes these incidents particularly demoralizing is their frequency on specific maps. Labs, Tarkov 's highest loot-tier map, is borderline unplayable during peak hours. Polls have even shown that 60–70% of Tarkov players report encountering suspicious behavior at least once per session. That's an unsustainable rate of loss for any game.

Battlestate's Latest Response to Cheaters

Battlestate Studio head Nikita Buyanov recently posted on X that the Tarkov 1.0 launch would include some tricks for hackers and "cheater scum." It's a welcome, if somewhat ambiguous statement, and to his credit, Buyanov has been candid about the back-and-forth between developers and cheat-makers. That honesty is valuable, but after years of ban waves that provide only temporary relief, it's difficult to imagine that this special surprise will do anything to stem the tide.

When New Content Comes at the Cost of Stability

While it's true that cheating dominates most community discussions, Escape from Tarkov 's performance issues are equally relevant, if only in ways that are harder to articulate. Battlestate's approach to updates is as follows: major content drops, accompanied by promises of performance improvements, followed by months of reporting that those improvements either never materialize or quickly regress. It has become the never-ending story of Tarkov 's development, suggesting a serious problem with Battlestate's update prioritization.

When Streets of Tarkov launched in late 2022, it tanked frame rates on even the most high-end hardware. Two years on, and despite multiple optimization patches, those issues still persist.

Nearly every update includes optimization in its patch notes, yet what players actually feel instead is a steady stream of new weapons, attachments, questlines, and mechanics. These additions keep the game feeling fresh and attract attention, but they arrive on a foundation that still can't reliably deliver smooth gameplay. If 1.0 cannot buck this trend, it won't be easy to meaningfully differentiate it from a regular Escape from Tarkov content update.

The Double-Edged Nature of Tarkov's Development

What makes these issues worse and Tarkov such an unusual case in general is that the game has always been shaped more directly by the community and by Buyanov himself. Battlestate has managed to earn a rare sense of developer authenticity through its level of involvement with the community, but it's also created some serious discrepancies in the game's lifespan when it chooses to go dark.

Changes to Escape from Tarkov 's core systems can be drastic from one patch to the next, even to the degree of swapping up its entire difficulty curve. Escape from Tarkov 's hardcore and softcore meta experiments, for example, represented opposite philosophies on loot and progression, leaving many (myself included) unsure which version of the game Battlestate actually wanted to build.

Battlestate's Development Philosophy Leaves Tarkov Wildly Unsettled

This unpredictability extends beyond game balance as well. Entire updates have been postponed or canceled on short notice, sometimes with little explanation. Discussions about a console version of Escape from Tarkov have come and gone, and then returned, and for a project that has been in development for nearly a decade, this volatility only stands to undermine the sense of permanence and polish a 1.0 release should represent, even before it is released.

1.0 Is a Make-or-Break Moment for Battlestate

Ultimately, Escape from Tarkov 1.0 seems like a substantial update, and for the most part, what's coming genuinely sounds promising. The release will include the game's long-promised campaign mode, complete with cutscenes and structured quests, as well as the addition of a new map called Terminal. Yet, if the launch comes and goes without meaningful improvements to performance or anti-cheat, I can't see how these additions won't end up feeling hollow. Players will always welcome new maps and missions, but until the game runs smoothly and fairly, no amount of additional content will change how fragile it feels.

Escape from Tarkov

item.title: Diablo 4 is Going to Look Very Different For Some Players Soon
item.description:
Diablo 4 is coming to China soon, albeit with some significant changes, including blood becoming dust, skulls becoming creepy masks, and bones becoming stone. While Chinese gamers will soon be able to play Diablo 4 , it is going to look a little different from the game fans have been playing for the last couple of years.

In 2024, NetEase and Blizzard renewed their partnership, beginning the process of bringing back games like World of Warcraft , Hearthstone , and Overwatch 2 to China after over a year of service being unavailable. However, Diablo 4 , which was released after the dissolution of their original agreement, had never been licensed in China, meaning it could not return as easily as the other games. After over a year of waiting, the companies reached a windfall in July 2025, when the Chinese National Press and Publication Administration approved Diablo 4 for an import license.

Changes to Diablo 4 in China

  • All blood is changed to dust
  • Skulls on icons like Penetrating Shot are changed to masks or heads
  • Certain monsters changed to be less skeletal or gruesome (e.g., Wandering Death made of stone)

Now, Diablo 4 is finally arriving in China on December 12, albeit with some pretty big changes. In order to secure this license, Diablo 4 had to remove certain elements from the game at the request of the NPPA. Now that the pre-release trial event for Diablo 4 is live in China, players are starting to get a feel for what these changes will look like. For starters, all blood splatters in the game have been replaced with dust. Additionally, skulls on many icons, such as the Rogue’s Penetrating Shot, have been changed to creepy masks. Perhaps one of the more noticeable changes in this version of Diablo 4 is Wandering Death, a frightening skeletal world boss that has become a solid stone construct in the Chinese version.

Many Western games approved for Chinese release go through similar adjustments to any blood, gore, bones, spirits, and religious iconography. For example, many undead creatures in World of Warcraft in China have been changed to remove these elements. In fact, the playable Forsaken model was redesigned to not have any bones jutting out from their arms and legs – a character customization that was later ported globally as an option for all fans.

These changes are only cosmetic; outside these visual elements, Diablo 4 players in China will ostensibly be able to enjoy the same ARPG that players are familiar with.

Season 11 of Diablo 4 arrives elsewhere on December 9, only a few days before its debut in China. With Divine Gifts, the invasion of Azmodan and the Lesser Evils, and the new Tower leaderboard system in Diablo 4 , fans across the globe can look forward to an exciting end to 2025.

118
7.5 /10
9 /10

Diablo 4

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Diablo® IV is the ultimate action-RPG experience with endless evil to slaughter, countless abilities to master, nightmarish dungeons, and legendary loot.

Embark on the epic campaign solo or with friends, meeting memorable characters through a gripping story in a beautifully dark world, or explore an expansive end game: battle iconic bosses for powerful loot, fight back the encroaching onslaught of Hell in Helltides, master the Forge to create your ultimate weapons and progress powerful characters, with cross-play and cross-progression on all available platforms.

Welcome to Hell

Discover the critically acclaimed franchise that defined the Action RPG genre. As the battle between the High Heavens and Burning Hells rages on, hatred devours Sanctuary as evil spreads and a new wave of cultists and worshippers arise to embrace Lilith’s coming. Only a brave few dare to face this threat and bring light to the all-consuming darkness.

Expansive Open World

Forge your own path through the corrupted lands of Sanctuary, an ever-growing, fully explorable world teeming with challenges, quests, enemies, and loot. Join your fellow adventurers, rescue and retake besieged towns, delve into nightmarish dungeons and uncover lost secrets as you fight back evil. The many zones of Sanctuary are yours to explore, and with rotating areas of extreme peril like World Bosses and Helltide, danger lurks at every turn.

Immersive Character Development

Create and customize your character to face the encroaching darkness. Choose from one of five classes and build your hero with skills, abilities and cosmetics, creating a champion that is uniquely your own. Grow stronger as you progress through powerful Skill Trees and develop even more unique end game specializations with Paragon Boards.

Legendary Gear, Epic Battles

Discover and experiment with a vast arsenal of powerful weapons, armor and more to fight back against the demons threatening Sanctuary. Explore unique combinations, create your own upgrades and collect a plethora of powerful tools to battle in immersive, action-packed combat against the deadliest of enemies.

Seasons & Events

The tales of Sanctuary continue to unfold. Create Seasonal Characters and join in fresh adventures - master new mechanics and take on the latest threats in each new Season. Complete harrowing feats of the Season Journey and earn new Battle Pass rewards. Plus, sharpen your swords and get in the spirit of the seasons when Limited-Time Events sweep through Sanctuary.

End Game Undertakings

There’s even more Diablo® IV to explore as you reach higher levels and more fearsome World Tiers. Face the greatest challenge yet as you take on the most powerful demons in The Pit, steel yourself against Uber Bosses to reap uber unique rewards, fight back overflowing armies of Hell as Helltides emerge across Sanctuary, battle larger-than-life World Bosses, and master the Forge to create the mightiest weapons fit for a hero.

item.title: How to Get Free Items in Anno: 117 Pax Romana (Launch Twitch Drops)
item.description:
Anno 117: Pax Romana is nearly here, which means players can begin preparing themselves to become Roman governors. There is a lot that will need to be managed in order to bring prosperity to the Roman Empire.

Whether players intend to play Anno117: Pax Romana on launch day or they'd rather wait for reviews or a sale, they can start collecting items for the civilizations that they will lead once they get their hands on the game. To promote the launch of Anno 117 , Ubisoft is hosting an event and giving away free cosmetic items as Twitch drops.

How to Get Anno 117: Pax Romana Launch Twitch Drops

From November 10 until November 14, players can watch Anno 117: Pax Romana livestreams on Twitch and earn free in-game rewards once they get their hands on the game - whether that's on release day or in the distant future.

In total, there are four rewards for players to collect as Twitch drops. Here is how to unlock each one of them:

  • Classic Nova Alba Ship skin - Watch 2 hours of Anno 117: Pax Romana livestreams on Ubisoft's Twitch channel
  • Legion Trading Post Kontor skin - Watch 4 hours of Anno 117: Pax Romana livestreams on Ubisoft's Twitch channel
  • Gronkh logo - Watch 2 hours of Anno 117: Pax Romana livestreams on Gronkh's Twitch channel
  • Gronkh flag - Watch 3 hours of Anno 117: Pax Romana livestreams on Gronkh's Twitch channel
  • Cringer logo - Watch 2 hours of Anno 117: Pax Romana livestreams on Cringer's Twitch channel
  • Cringer flag - Watch 3 hours of Anno 117: Pax Romana livestreams on Cringer's Twitch channel

Before players start watching the streams, they should make sure that they've connected their Twitch account and their Ubisoft Connect account. To do this, they must select their account icon on the top right corner of the screen, select Settings, and then open the Connections tab. If they scroll down, they will find the Ubisoft section where they can link the two accounts, making it possible for them to claim Twitch drops.
